token.description: The token of the bot to use.

channel-id.description: The channel ID the bot should write to.

channel-name-online-format.description: When this field is set, the channel name will be set to this format. $n is replaced with the number of online players. For example, you can set this field to "server-$n" so the channel appears as #server-5 when 5 players are online.

discord-prefix.description: The prefix Discord commands will use.

game-message-format.description: The message format going into the game. ($user = sender, $message = content, $color = role hex color, $role = see discord-roles)

discord-message-format.description: The message format going to Discord. ($user = sender, $message = content, $role = see game-roles)

join-message-format.description: The message format into Discord when a user joins the game. ($user = joining user)

leave-message-format.description: The message format into Discord when a user leaves the game. ($user = leaving user)

server-start-format.description: The messate format into Discord when the server starts. ($map = the map)

game-roles.description: A list of items in the format ROLENAME:TEXT. When $role is included in a message format, the user's highest role with TEXT set in this field is used. For example, you can set Admin:[Admin] to make users with the role Admin have $role set to [Admin]. Use the role name "default" (no quotes) to indicate no roles.

discord-roles.description: A list of items in the format ROLENAME:TEXT. When $role is included in a message format, the user's highest role with TEXT set in this field is used. For example, you can set Admin:[Admin] to make users with the role Admin have $role set to [Admin].

verified-role.description: The ID of the role to give to verified users. When blank, the role is not given.

verified-nickname.descrpition: Whether or not to nickname Discord users their Brickadia username.
